description: Demolition of numbers 1-4 Wilton Parade and 20, 22, 22a High Street, Feltham and construction of nursery, retail unit, car parking, 112 residential units and associated external works
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the extension hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building.

Condition : 3 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority (before the building(s) is/are occupied/used).

Condition : 4 - A scheme of phasing and timetable of development and timing of construction shall be submitted to and agreed by the Local Planning Authority before development commences and the development shall be implemented in accordance with that scheme unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 5 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place above existing ground level until detailed drawings of the proposed balconies and railings have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 7 - No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of   8am  to   6pm  on Mondays to Friday and   8.30am  to   1pm   on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and public holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 8 - Before commencement of operations, a scheme shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to cover the following matters:

(i)	any external illumination of the site

(ii)	measures to ensure that all mud and other loose materials are not carried on the wheels and chassis of any vehicles leaving the site; and

(iii)	measures to minimise dust nuisance caused by the operations and to ensure that no dust or other debris is carried on to the adjoining properties.

The scheme so approved should be fully implemented.

Condition : 9 - No commercial floorspace exceeding 1,772 square metres shall be formed within the buildings hereby permitted by means of internal horizontal division without prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 10 - No fans, louvres, ducts or other external plant shall be installed without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 11 - The use of the day nursery shall not commence until details of the opening hours for the day nursery have been submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The day nursery shall not be used outside the agreed hours.

Condition : 12 - Before the development is commenced a scheme for protecting the proposed residential accommodation from excessive external noise shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and any works which form part of such a scheme shall be completed before any part of the development is first occupied or used.

Condition : 13 - The use of the car park shall not commence until details of the location, type and appearance of all the directional signage in the car park for pedestrians (including disabled) to the public and private lifts have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The signage shall be erected in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 14 - Before the development is commenced details of vehicular and cycle access to and within the car park, including widths and gradients of the ramps; location, type and operation of barriers to and within the car park; circulation space; disabled parking spaces; lighting;  CCTV and internal treatment of the car park shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved scheme and permanently retained thereafter.

Condition : 15 - Before the development is commenced, details of cycle access to, and details of cycle parking in the car park and the total number of cycle parking spaces for the whole development for the public and residents shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the spaces shown on any of the approved drawings shall be available for use before first occupation of any part of the development and permanently maintained and retained thereafter.

Condition : 16 - No development shall take place above existing ground level until the remaining details of cycle parking for the public and residents at ground level have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and the spaces shown on any of the approved drawings shall be available for use before first occupation of the buildings and permanently maintained and retained thereafter.

Condition : 17 - Prior to any construction work on the development hereby approved commencing on site details of the arrangements for the construction traffic shall be agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority and shall include routes and access arrangements, hours of deliveries, wheel cleansing facilities and waiting areas.

Condition : 18 - Unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority no part of the development shall be occupied until the works for the improvement of the access arrangements at the following junctions have been approved and completed to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority:-

?	High Street/Bedfont Lane Junction

	In accordance with a scheme to be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced.

Condition : 19 - No development shall take place until details of earthworks have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  These details shall include the proposed grading and mounding of land areas including the levels and contours to be formed, showing the relationship of proposed mounding to existing vegetation and surrounding land form.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 20 - No development shall take place within the area indicated on drawing received on 6th May 2003 and 6th August 2003, until the applicant, or their agents or successors in title, has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work in accordance with a written scheme of investigation, including the timetable for the investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 21 - Construction of the car parks shall not commence until details for their ventilation (including details of sound attenuation for any necessary mechanical plants and the standard of dilution expected) has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The scheme once approved shall be implemented before the car park are first used and permanently retained in full working order thereafter.

Condition : 22 - The construction of the foul and surface water drainage system shall be carried out in accordance with details submitted to and approved in writing by the Planning Authority before the development commences.

Condition : 23 - No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before (the use hereby permitted is commenced) or (before the building(s) is/are occupied) or (in accordance with a timetable agreed in writing with the local planning authority).  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 24 - No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved.  These details shall include (proposed finished levels or contours; means of enclosure; car parking layouts; other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; hard surfacing material; minor artefacts and structures (eg. furniture, play equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting etc); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (eg drainage power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports etc); retained historic landscape features and proposals for restoration, where relevant).

Soft landscape works shall include (planting plans; written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme)

Condition : 25 - All hard and soft landscape works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  The works shall be carried out prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed with the local planning authority

Condition : 26 - No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of (    ) years has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The schedule shall include details of the arrangements for its implementation.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.

Condition : 28 - In this condition "retained tree" means an existing tree which is to be retained in accordance with the approved plans and particulars; and paragraphs (a) and (b) below shall have effect until the expiration of (5 years?) from (the date of the occupation of the building for its permitted use).

(a)	No retained tree shall be cut down, uprooted or destroyed, nor shall any retained tree be topped or lopped other than in accordance with the approved plans and particulars, without the written approval of the local planning authority.  Any topping or lopping approved shall be carried out in accordance with British Standard[3998 (Tree Work)] or any other BS replacing.

(b)	If any retained tree is removed, uprooted or destroyed or dies, another tree shall be planted at the same place and that tree shall be of such size and species, and shall be planted at such time, as may be specified in writing by the local planning authority.

(c)	The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved plans and particulars before any equipment, machinery or materials are brought on to the site for the purposes of the development, and shall be maintained until all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site.  Nothing shall be stored or placed in any area fenced in accordance with this condition and the ground levels within those areas shall not be altered, nor shall any excavation be made, without the written consent of the local planning authority.

Condition : 29 - The use hereby permitted shall not be begun until details of the arrangements for storing of waste and recycled materials have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The arrangements for storing waste and recycled materials shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with any approval given and shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.
Condition : 30 - No additional flank windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in any wall of the development hereby approved without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 31 - Details of lux levels, direction and screening of any floodlighting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before [the use hereby permitted] commences and the buildings are occupied.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 32 - No development shall take place above existing ground levels on the site until details of the levels have been submitted to the Local Planning Authority, and the development shall take place in accordance with those levels.

Condition : 33 - Before the development commences, a detailed site investigation shall be carried out to establish if the site is contaminated, to assess the degree and nature of the contamination present, and to determine its potential for the pollution of the water environment. The method and extent of the site investigation shall be agreed with the Planning Authority prior to commencement of the work. Details of appropriate measures to prevent pollution of groundwater and surface water, including provisions for monitoring, shall then be submitted to and approved in writing by the Planning Authority before development commences. The development shall then proceed in strict accordance with the measures approved.

Condition : 34 - No development approved by this permission shall be commenced until a landfill gas risk assessment has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Where a risk from mitigating gas is identified, appropriate works to mitigate the effects of gas shall be incorporated in detailed plans to be approved by the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 35 - The waste and recycled materials storage arrangements shown on the approved drawing shall be completed before any part of the accommodation hereby permitted is occupied.

Condition : 36 - Before development commences details of sightlines at the point of access to the public highway shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the development shall be carried out in accordance with the details.

Condition : 37 - Before development within any phase previously agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority is commenced a scheme indicating the provision to be made for disabled people to gain access to the car parks, lifts, toilets, and all other commercial spaces, shall have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The agreed scheme shall be implemented before the development hereby permitted is brought into use.

Condition : 38 - The roof area of the extension hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area without the grant of further specific permission from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 39 - Before commencement of development, a parking management scheme shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority to cover the following matters:

(i)	signing and road marking
(ii)	internal circulation
(iii)	allocation of spaces
(iv)	pricing and method of payment
(v)	pedestrian routes
(vi)	method of operation of barriers
(vii)	hours of operation
(viii)	parking enforcement

The scheme so approved should be fully implemented prior to the occupation of the premises.

Condition : 40 - Before the development is commenced, details of the proposed balconies, railings, canopies, gates and fenestration shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority and the works identified in the details so approved shall be completed before any part of the development is first occupied or used.
